intro: Diostea infuscata, commonly known as the dark-stemmed diostea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, where it thrives in warm, humid climates. The plant is characterized by its dark, woody stems and large, heart-shaped leaves that can reach up to 30 cm in diameter. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant, and it produces small, yellow fruits that are edible when ripe. Diostea infuscata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and as a source of edible produce in local cuisines.
